alert.note: Alert for Bradford (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 22 at 3:39AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON EDT TODAY THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...A band of thunderstorms will setup with heavy rainfall. Areas seeing multiple thunderstorms may expect 1-3 inches of rain with locally higher amounts to 5 inches. Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central New York and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following areas, in central New York, Chemung, Schuyler, Seneca, Southern Cayuga, Tioga, Tompkins and Yates. In northeast Pennsylvania, Bradford. * WHEN...From Noon EDT today through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
